column2: Freq: Prior to start of works
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• Lot shall be defined from pit to pit (or endwall, where applicable).
• Do survey boundaries clearly define the Underground Drainage Construction works?
Freq: Prior to start of works
• Is the Box Culvert free of defects and to drawing dimensions?
Freq: Prior to start of works
1.4 - Acceptance of Precast Reinforced Concrete/HDPE Pipes
• Is the Pipes free of defects and to drawing dimensions?
Freq: Prior to start of works
1.5 - Acceptance of Precast Covers, Grates, Lids and Pits
• Have proposed precast Covers, Grates, Lids and Pits been approved for use?
Freq: Prior to start of works
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• Is material free from perishable matter and lumps?
• Does the material comply with Table 701.091 & Table 701.092 below? Has the material been approved for use?
Material || Sieve - AS (mm) 75.0, 37.5, 19.0, 2.36, 0.075 :: Percentage Passing (by mass)
Freq: Prior to start of works
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• Is the trench clearance width between 300mm to 600mm?
Pipe Type || Nominal Pipe Diameter or Width (mm) || Horizontal Clearance to Wall of Trench :: Min. (mm) / Max. (mm)
Corrugated Metal Culvert || All || 300 mm / 1,000 mm
• Is the excavation at a sufficient depth for pipe/box culvert bedding?
• Is the pit excavation not less than 400mm from external pit wall to side of excavation?
• Is the excavation at a sufficient depth for pit bedding?
• Is the Pipe Diameter less than 1500mm? If so, has 100mm of bedding been placed?
• Is the Pipe Diameter greater than 1500mm? If so, has 200mm of bedding been placed?
• Has bedding been placed and compacted to a thickness not less than 80mm on clay foundation?
• Has bedding been placed and compacted to a thickness not less than 150mm on a rock foundation?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• Has bedding been compacted to refusal?
• Are pipes being laid from downstream end?
• Are socket ends of pipes being placed facing upstream and fully entered?
• Is the pipe in full contact with the bedding for the full length of each section?
• The compacted bedding shall be shaped to accommodate the joint collar and ensure that the pipe is supported along its full length.
• Have pre-cast pits been installed at the correct location and to the dimensions shown on the drawings?
• Have subsurface drainage connections been cored at appropriate dimensions?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• Test results for fibres and fibre content (if applicable) (Compliance Certificate provided by Supplier)
• Have pits greater than 1.0 meter been fitted with step irons?
• Step irons shall not obstruct openings or be fitted to a wall which has openings.
• Have step Irons shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions and are an approved proprietary type?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
4.4 - Shaping the floor and Surface Finish
• Has the drainage pit floors been smoothly shaped from the inlets to the outlet for a height of one third of the diameter of the outlet pipe with cementitious mortar?
• Surfaces shall be finished uniform in appearance with a Class 2 surface finish in accordance with the requirements of Section 610.
• Has the joints between drainage pits, access chambers and pipes shall be made watertight using a cementitious mortar?
• Are rubber rings to be used on rubber ring joint pipes clean and free of debris?
• Have all interlocking joint reinforced concrete pipes been jointed or wrapped with 200mm wide external joint rubber band?  Has the rubber band been placed between the spigot and socket?
• Have pipes with lifting holes been placed with lifting holes uppermost? Have lifting holes been plugged after pipe installation?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• Have consecutive sections of box culverts been firmly butted together?
• Does the mortar have a minimum 28 day compressive strength of not less than 40MPa? Is it at least Type C Class?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• Has the haunch zone been extended from top of bedding layer to 1/3 pipe diameter? Haunch zone material to be same as bedding layer. Haunch zone to be compacted to refusal in max 150mm layer.

• Is the pipe to be backfilled in under an area to be paved? If so, has excavation below design subgrade level been backfilled with select backfill material? And within the pavement layer backfilled with appropriate pavement material?

• Is the pipe to be backfilled in under an area to be paved? If so, has excavation below design subgrade level been backfilled with select backfill material? And within the pavement layer backfilled with appropriate pavement material?

• Is the pipe to be backfilled in under an area not to be paved? If so, has the trench been backfilled with select backfill material to a level 0.3m above the top of the culvert? Ordinary backfill may be used above that level.
• Has the backfill material been backfilled in max 150mm layers?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• Has the pit been backfilled in layers not exceeding 300mm? Pit backfill to be compacted to refusal using hand held equipment.
• Has the pipe been laid with adequate fall and invert levels within ±10mm of design?
• Is the invert level of pipes at pipes ±50mm of design?
• Is the line of the pit cover been installed ±10mm of the design kerb line?
• Is the pit cover level ±10 mm of the design level for that point?
• Is the offset of entry pits within ±20 mm of kerbs/barriers?
• Is the offset of entry pits within ±20 mm of kerbs/barries?
• Is the plan location of pits other than offsets to kerb lines or barriers ±100 mm?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
7.2 - Compaction and moisture content of backfill & bedding material
• Has a total of 3 compaction tests taken place, per lot, inclusive of pit compaction, achieving 97% compaction?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• Have all storm water lines been inspected by CCTV and found to be free of defects prior to placement of pavement?
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
Date NCR closed for this lot
